info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 2:56PM CST until February 19 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Areas of blowing and drifting snow expected, especially in open areas, due to southwest wind gusts to 40 mph this afternoon and northwest wind gusts to 45 mph tonight. Scattered briefly heavy snow showers with gusty winds and sharply reduced visibility possible early to mid-evening. * WHERE...Northeast Illinois and portions of northwest Indiana and north central Illinois. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Blowing and drifting snow resulting in snow covered roads, sharply reduced visibility and hazardous travel conditions, primarily in open areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The scattered snow showers this evening may produce bursts of heavy snow, sudden visibility reductions, and quick accumulations of less than one inch in 30 minutes or less.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Allow extra travel time and expect varying road conditions and visibility in open areas. In Illinois, the latest road conditions can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Indiana, the latest road conditions are available by calling 1-800-261-7623.
